title: WTO Chief Sees AI Boom Driving Potential Upside For 2026 Trade
description: The head of the World Trade Organization said the rapid acceleration of artificial intelligence may underpin global merchandise trade this year, helping overcome US tariff headwinds and lead to higher overall growth than currently projected.
content:
The head of the World Trade Organization said the rapid acceleration of artificial intelligence may underpin global merchandise trade this year, helping overcome US tariff headwinds and lead to higher overall growth than currently projected.

title: Five Ways People Are Using Claude Code
description: The artificial intelligence tool generates computer code when people type prompts, so those with no coding experience can create their own programs and apps.
content:
Claude Code, an artificial intelligence tool that can generate computer code when people type a prompt, is having a viral moment.
The tool, which the A.I. start-up Anthropic introduced in May, has shown record growth over the past two weeks, the comp... [1666 chars]

title: Rwanda to test AI-powered technology in clinics
description: Rwanda will test technology powered by artificial intelligence in more than 50 health clinics as part of a new initiative by the Gates Foundation to support 1,000 clinics across Africa with the aim to improve health care services.
content:

title: India seen as growth anchor amid challenging global conditions: CII
description: India was highlighted as a reliable long-term growth anchor at the World Economic Forum, owing to its macroeconomic stability and reform momentum. Discussions also centered on Artificial Intelligence, with India seen as well-positioned to leverage its digital market and STEM talent. The forum emphasized the need for supply chain resilience amidst geopolitical concerns.

title: NDP leadership candidate Avi Lewis goes after AI data centres
description: NDP leadership candidate Avi Lewis is calling for a moratorium on data centres along with other measures in a bid to rein in emerging generative artificial intelligence (AI) companies that he says are stealing private data, threatening jobs and harming the environment.
